title: U.S. Retail Sales Grew in February, Economists Estimate
sub_head: Consumers appeared willing to absorb rising inflation as Omicron threat faded last month ahead of the Ukraine crisis
body:
Americans kept up retail spending in February but at a slower pace than the prior month, economists estimate, as they assessed the implications of high inflation and Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
Economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal estimate that retail sales rose 0.4% in February from the previous month, easing from January’s strong 3.8% increase. Retail sales figures aren’t adjusted for inflation.
